title: Can nunu and Liss get actual passive abilities
body:
They are given situational no mana abilities, even though it is not up often, but to make up for one free ability every once in a while they get insanely high mana costs
Lissandra's Q, the one she is supposed to spam uses 85 mana at level 1
Why?
Nunu's E at level one costs a lot too
Not to mention their base mana/mana regen isn't that great anyways
Please fix them like you fixed veigar
actually give them a passive ability
EDIT: Oh my, that's a lot of upvotes
Thanks for all the support <3

replies.body: Ummm what's wrong with lissandras passive? Being able to cast an ability for free every so many seconds is bad?

Because they "balanced" it by giving her artificially high mana costs.

It would be like if Burger King said they were selling Whoppers at 90% off, then raised the price of a Whopper to $50.

To give you a better analogy that has more to do with LoL:

They gutted {{champion:98}} and {{champion:82}}'s base HP and armor to compensate for their passive shields.

{{champion:14}} also gets a very low base HP despite having infinite HP stacking (I believe he needs about 200 farm to have HP comparing to Alistar's base HP) however he still gets infinite HP stacking so this is not a completely serious problem.

{{champion:266}} {{champion:18}} {{champion:268}} {{champion:131}} also get low base attack speed despite them having attack speed steroids. This may not seem like it is a problem but it means they get less attack speed from building more attack speed than champions with higher base attack speed.

Actually, they have a decent to above average  base attack-speed. Azir and Diana have low attack speed growth. but have a average base attack speed. Diana was never meant to a auto attack based champion, and a good portion of Azir's Attack Speed is locked up in his W. Morde's shield is dumb, so I cant argue with that, but for shen, he have one of the most powerful defensive steroid on his W.
Diana's three hit passive seems to argue against her not being a AA based champion, so does her kit that focus on keeping people right next to her.

Um, you realize that that they gave Diana a low base attack speed exactly so she couldn't hit high levels of attack speed off of the limited AP beneficial attack speed items?  That is why she is permanently granted 20% bonus attack speed through her passive so she has a relatively normal starting attack speed for her passive procs, but is hard to scale to absurd levels from building bonus attack speed.  That is why her passive is allowed to have the absurd base damage and scaling that it has.

It was set up purely to balance her, where some attack speed is nice, but doesn't become her identity.

can kog'maw get an actual passive too? where i don't have to die to make use of it? thx

Kog's passive is actually good since it does true AoE damage
Considering how immobile Kog is he will be dying a lot
it encourages dying for little in return. the MS granted hardly catches up to majority of the roster

No, it does not encourage dying at all. It discourages enemies from killing Kog'Maw in the first place. So if an assassin ends up bursting down Koggy, the enemy team would have to deal with 500 AOE true damage.

Note: I see your name, but that doesn't negate my counterargument.

i understand that the true damage is a threat however it doesn't discourage people from killing me. currently the meta is diver jungle that potentially one-shots (vi, hecarim, lee sin, khazix) ADCs that play safe and have poke and don't have to worry about getting close, they tend to have MS boosts or CC to help them escape/engage safely (Jhin, Caitlyn, Varus). mages bursty/sustain doesn't really matter (pretty much every mage). tanks (can't do much to a 4k health garen regardless of how low i've gotten him). 

1. ADC with their passive as their core damaging identity: Ashe, Caitlyn, Jhin, Graves, Quinn, Kindred.
2. ADC with their passive as all-time usable: Vayne, Sivir, Tristana, Twitch, Draven, Kalista.
3. ADC with their passive as situational but always tide-turning: Varus, Jinx, Ezreal, Miss Fortune, Lucian.

Every ADC listed has a MS passive/active/debuff that help them 1) kite 2) escape 3) engage/disengage. meanwhile kog'maw get a MS steroid only after he dies. the only "ADC" that doesn't have a MS boost/debuff is Urgot but I am going to do whatever in my power to not let Riot do that to Kog'Maw. I get that Kog'Maw is supposed to be an immobile glass cannon, but no one cares if you don't have CC/ abilities that can help you re-position. this is why he has a 1.2% play rate and will continue to be neglected as long as its that low.

Now let us compare Kog'maw's passive to other champions with death as condition to trigger:

1. Resurrecting passive: Zac, Anivia, Aatrox - I'm pretty sure if they die during clash, they will be completely ignored and successfully rebirth.
2. Revenge-killing passive: Karthus, Sion - These two can wipe a team or really aid in killing. It's like, let's kill them last because their presence in clash will be disastrous. Besides, they aren't ADCs. Zyra's passive was remade because it's MEH. It's just fun when you can kill with it.

if your only argument is "AoE True damage" then play at least 10 games and tell me how often you get a kill with the passive.

Nunu's passive is actually super strong compared to Liss's, with some attack speed he can be immune to mana costs. The reason Liss's costs are so high is because her poke and push power would be too high early; and, let's be honest, if you're playing an AP mid you're rushing morello's, so mana costs aren't an issue once you hit 6.

Nunu's mana costs aren't even high. Riot basically really wants this guy to be a viable Support option but people dismiss him. In previous seasons, it was all about the healers (and Zilean) but now that Braum and Tahm Kench are here (and Ivern as well) he isn't that bad of an option.

With over 200K on Lissandra, I have to say I like her passive. You're not supposed to be able just spam your Q pre level 6. Her Q has a low cooldown because late game her basic attacks do nothing unless you build Lich Bane and spam cast Q with an auto to follow. Her passive also allows for some incredible outplays. Your opponent sees your mana bar is low and decides since they are full HP they will dive you for the "easy kill." Little do they know, with 85 mana you can cast an ult to stun them under tower and deal damage and as soon as it wears off you have enough mana to hit a second CC and finish the kill. It also makes it incredibly easy to manage her mana early.

Here's some math.

Early game lissandra's Q costs 85 mana.
Every 18 seconds she gets a free cast.

If you cast a Q every 9 seconds you can essentially half the mana cost. And one Q every 9 seconds will leave most any midlaner hurting early game if you have half a clue how to proc thunderlords. To be honest, If you're having trouble with Lissandra's passive it's likely because you spam cast Q too early. If they lowered the mana cost of her Q it would allow her to spam more and potentially break her.

If they change her passive she no longer has the mana management that gives her the early sustain she desperately needs.

Sorry to disagree with OP but Liss is fine the way she is. If anything needs to be changed, it's Ahri/Ziggs.

Lissandra is a champion gated severely by her prevalence in Professional play. 
Her current passive is nothing more then an excuse to give her exceedingly high mana costs. 

Whilst it's not the only mana passive in the game, with Nunu, Evelynn, Xerath and pre-MYMU Veigar all having Mana-based passives, Lissandra's is the most low-effort and least interactive of the bunch. 

Nunu's requires him to adjust his build, Evelynn only benefits from hers when she's invisible and is de-activated upon being visible, She's another culprit the same as Lissandra, that being said she's in line for a VGU already. Xerath is required to interact with his enemy laner to reap full benefits. 
Lissandra's Passive on the other hand is only a stationery cooldown, and is only lowered by doing something she would be doing whether she did or did not have her passive. Not too mention it's only her Q and Ultimate that apply to her passive anyways, considering W roots, and E does not slow and Spell effects are not taken into account. 
 
Lissandra is not fine the way she is and Riot has already expressed that.
They aren't satisfied with her current passive and thinks it could use some serious work.

My idea for a Lissandra passive would be for her to leave a trail of frost behind her, the trail boosts Allies movement speed by 12/18/24% when followed along, and slows enemies movement speed by 10/16/22%.  

Could obviously use fine tuning but the idea is basically a built in Elxir of Iron.

The problem with that in itself would be it's a built in Elixir of Iron; it's not very unique. Kind of like how Brand's passive was reworked because it was pretty much the same as a Rylai's/Liandry's build on other mages.
Ironically, there WAS in fact a time her passive was actually good, which was just after the mana regen changes to items. It was a part of the reason Liss was so good at that point in time.
